Name: Flávio Carneiro
Sumário:
Professional with 26 years of experience working in the aeronautical, textile and packaging industries. 

Large experience in multinational companies with roles in different cultures and processes, being in charge in the last 10 years as the first executive of business in Brazil and abroad. 

Responsibility for full P&L, revenue around USD 150 million, multiple manufacturing facilities, 800+ employees and 300+ clients.

History of success in commercial field and generation of value to clients, consolidation and realignment of businesses, start-ups, turnarounds, development of high-performance teams and commitment to safeguard the safety and welfare of the employees. 

Driving for results and organization alignment on achieving stretch goals, ease to building formal and informal relationships within and outside the organization, ability to seek solutions that meet the needs of the various stakeholders, ability to persuade to win support and commitment from others , comfortable in acting in ambiguous environments and the courage to face and do what must be done in difficult times. 

Certified Director by Brazilian Institute of Corporate Governance (IBGC), experience as board member of family business and entrepreneur (idealization, execution and management of own business).

Mission of life: be a servant leader, holding people accountable and to give their best as professionals and human beings in order to contribute for the longevity of companies and build a better society.

•	Planejamento, orçamento e gerenciamento das contas de látex, matérias-primas e embalagens (R$ 115.000.000,00/ano) imprescindíveis para o abastecimento da planta fabril.

•	Busca e desenvolvimento de fornecedores nacionais e internacionais, incluindo visitas à Guatemala, Tailândia e Malásia para avaliar e garantir boas práticas de fornecimento de matérias-primas, peças de reposição, maquinários e tecnologias de fabricação de luvas em geral.
•	Adequação de layout de expedição, almoxarifado para aumento da eficiência de inbound e outbound de materiais.

Name: Alex Souza
Sumário:
Sou formado em engenharia mecatrônica pela Universidade Paulista e certificado pela Harvard Management Company em Gestão de Crises, Negociações e Diversidade. Tenho desenvolvido ampla experiência profissional na área industrial e, hoje, atuo como Diretor Industrial corporativo da cadeia de embalagens plásticas flexíveis stretch e shrink, das unidades Valfilm Brasil e USA.
Na Valfilm, sou responsável pela supervisão e gerenciamento dos processos e metas de produção do Stretch e Shrink.
Oriento a expansão das instalações industriais, acompanho o desempenho da produção, avalio os aspectos econômicos relacionados ao processo produtivo, aumento da competitividade e lucratividade, além de supervisionar a criação novos produtos e equipamentos.
Coordeno a satisfação do atendimento ao Cliente e desenvolvimento das equipes de Produção, Controle da Qualidade, Manutenção, Sistema Gestão Integrada, Suporte ao Cliente, Assistência Técnica, Desenvolvimento, Laboratório, Expedição e PCP.
- 
I have a degree in Mechatronics Engineering from Universidade Paulista and certified by Harvard Management Company in Crisis Management, Negotiation and Diversity. I have developed extensive professional experience in the industrial area and today I serve as Corporate Industrial Director of the flexible plastic stretch and shrink packaging chain, Valfilm Brazil and USA units.
 At Valfilm, I am responsible for supervising and managing Stretch and Shrink production processes and goals.
I coordinate the expansion of industrial facilities, monitor production performance, evaluate economic aspects related to the production process, increase competitiveness and profitability, and supervise the creation of new products and equipment.
Also, I´m in charge of the satisfaction of the customer service and team development of Production, Quality Control, Maintenance, Integrated Management System, Customer Support, Technical Assistance, Development, Laboratory, Expedition and PCP.

Nome: Coca-Cola FEMSA 
Localização: Não existente 
Descrição: At Coca Cola Femsa I created the sourcing structure Sudamérica with Spend $ 5,000 MM and together with this team through strategic negotiations got 7% in Savings contributing significantly to improve EBITDA of the Division and transforming sourcing in a Business Partner of the operations. This process took place in three phases:

Brazil centralization: Centralization of purchasing structure in an administrative office located in SP. In this process, we achieve an optimization of purchasing processes benefiting internal customers. In addition, we achieve TCO savings of $ 4MM.

Mercosur Centralization: Design of a Mercosur procurement team covering operations in Brazil and Argentina, strategically negotiating the major categories of the business. Participating in the Business Plan meetings of these countries and influencing strategic decisions of investment and acquisitions. At this stage we segregate the roles of buyers, creating the roles of traders and buyers, the latter being responsible for the operational activities and the first by tactics ones. With this, and the negotiations of division strategic purchasing team, we reached USD 2.5 MM in additional savings.

South America Centralization: Incorporation of Colombia and Venezuela in the Division purchasing team, contributing to better financial and operational results for the organization. 

Even in Coca Cola Femsa, I was responsible for develop and implement of a Business Intelligence department within the sourcing area which implemented a supplier development process in order to promote a rapprochement between suppliers, buyers and internal customers, recognize the best suppliers and through action plans and semiannual reviews, develop suppliers with growth potential partnerships. This team implemented a new system of Contract Management - South America optimizing the electronic approval and contract management earning 30% on time and 100% approval in advance before negotiations and due dates. 
Tempo de trabalho: 2010/2015 
Nível: Sourcing Head Sudamérica

In addition, I developed the whole redesign the structure of regional purchases for non-cosmetics business

Gerenciamento do planejamento de produção, logística, produção, compras, engenharia (manutenção), sistemas de qualidade, engenharia de produto e segurança laboratorial;

Liderança de  6 gerentes e 900 funcionários em duas fábricas e reporte diretamente ao Presidente da Empresa;

Implementei jornada LEAN MANUFACTURING na planta do Rio de Janeiro;

No orçamento de 2011, conquistei excelentes resultados e uma economia de 3% das vendas (US $ 9 milhões), e uma redução adicional de 15% do estoque (US $ 2 milhões).  

O Grupo Brasil vendeu a empresa em junho de 2012.

Responsável pela reestruturação das operações industriais da empresa.  Gestão do Planejamento da Produção, Logística, Compras, Produção, Manutenção, Qualidade, Engenharia de Produto e Ambiental;

 Liderança de 3 gestores e 300 colaboradores e reportar diretamente ao Presidente da Empresa,

Gestão da empresa com metas estabelecidas e indicadores de performance, manutenção preventiva, redução de contratos de serviços, custos logísticos e ganho de eficiências operacionais.

Implantação do programa Quality 5S e campanha Good idea, gerando economia significativa para a empresa.  Economia anual de 12,5% nas vendas (US $ 7,5 milhões).

Name: Marcelino Campos Vidal Junior
Sumário:
Iniciamos como vendedor direto para indústrias, com o tempo assumimos uma supervisão de vendas para a região do Paraná, com o bom desempenho agregamos também o estado de Santa Catarina, realizada um reestruturação na área comercial passamos a Gerente regional do Sul levando a área ter uma participação superior a 20% do geral da empresa.
Estes resultados me levaram a ser designado como o responsável nacional pela abertura de distribuidores para uma nova fase de trabalho. Passamos em um prazo de dois anos a atuarmos com 25 distribuidores em todo território nacional atuando com uma marca exclusiva para este canal.
Passado esta fase assumimos as contas chaves, ou grandes contas GPA, Wal Mart e Carrefour, atuando para minimizar os impactos dos contratos nas margens sendo que conseguimos reduzir consideravelmente os percentuais transformando estas contas em contas positivas.
Assumimos após esta passagem a Gerencia de Marketing e Produto na qual desempenhamos a função estritamente de mercado, ou seja, atuamos no desenvolvimento das estratégias comercias, políticas comerciais, analises de operações e viabilidade de negociações.
Além destas atribuições também desempenhamos as funções de pesquisas de mercado para novos produtos, feiras, eventos, convenções.
Na Diretoria Comercial a um ano conseguimos melhorar nossa participação de mercado com um crescimento de mais de 20% nas margens e um crescimento de 15% no volume financeiro.
Acredito ser um breve resumo de minhas atividades.

Nome: Nx Boats - Indústria Comércio de Produtos Náuticos LTDA

Atuando na área de inspeção dos barcos, especificamente em cada setor/processo (Pintura em Gel, Laminação, Desmolde, Rebarba, Acabamento e Montagem).  Com o objetivo de identificar e mapear todos os problemas encontrados na linha de produção, montando os gráficos de Pareto por setor para melhor visualização dos principais problemas, com foco principal em montar um plano de ação para sanar a causa raiz do problema.

• Pós Venda

Acompanhar e montar relatório com todos os problemas apresentados nos barcos, pós venda, entrando em contato diretamente com o cliente/revenda. Tendo como principal objetivo sanar os problemas apontados e apresentar um plano de melhoria para tais, dando foco nos problemas reincidente.

Nome: Estaleiro Atlântico Sul S.A. 
Localização: Não existente 
Descrição: • Aplicação direta das ferramentas do Lean Manufacturing nas células da fábrica, como Mapeamento do fluxo de valor, trabalho padronizado, PDCA, Kaizen, Kaban, 5S e 4C. Redução de Setup, TPM, 5W2H, Diagrama de Ishikawa, Pareto, Fluxogramas, Acompanhamento de KPI’s de processo produtivo e identificação dos principais pontos de perdas.

• Participação de desenvolvimento de projetos para tornar a empresa mais competitiva, melhorando os indicadores e processos, usando os conceitos Lean. Com o propósito de fabricar 7 navios/ano tão quanto Japão.

• Abertura e Tratativas das RNCs (Registro de não conformidades). O processo funciona pelo SAP (Second Audio Program) onde nele podemos, abrir, tratar e acompanhar todas as RNCs.

• Realizar levantamento de dados para implantação do “Yamazumi” na fábrica, com o intuito de evidenciar as atividades que agregam e não agregam valor, gerando gráficos GBO/GBM e calculando o tempo takt da célula estudada. Com a finalidade de acompanhar grupos de estagiários e multiplicar a metodologia “Yamazumi”, orientando os mesmos na compilação de dados para desenhar processos.

Name: Jerry Trousdale
Sumário:
CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER with extensive success in high level finance, accounting and operations leadership positions in privately and publicly held companies.  Strong focus on accounting and finance operations, process redesign and implementation, budgeting, forecasting and financial reporting for multiple business units within parent organizations.  Consistently deliver significant short and long term cost savings by identifying risks, decreasing expenses and proactively creating systems and best practices that result in enhanced organizational efficiency, performance, productivity and increased enterprise value.  Manage multi-million dollar budgets, P&Ls and reduce excess expenditures creating significant operational savings and increasing enterprise value. 

EXECUTIVE HIGHLIGHTS  - SCHOLLE IPN CORPORATION

*Member of a three-person executive leadership team including CEO and General Counsel that significantly increased global EBITDA  through contract renegotiations, cost reductions, material substitutions, 80/20 analysis and lean and mini business initiatives.  Significantly increased EBITDA margin by moving company from bottom quartile to top quartile for flexible packaging companies, and improved ROCE performance to top decile performance.

*Divested non-core assets and businesses, simplifying administration and reporting and greatly improving liquidity and deleveraging company 

*De-risked defined benefit pension plan resulting in notable tax savings, annual pension expense savings to the Corporation and annual expense savings to the plan.
Ocupação: Chief Financial Officer (CFO), Vice President - Finance
Empresas:
Nome: Scholle IPN 
Localização: Northlake, IL 
Descrição: Global manufacturer of flexible packaging and related filling equipment  with 2,100 employees in 14 countries throughout North America, Latin America, Europe, Asia and Australia.  Global leader in bag-in-box packaging.

Lead global finance organization of over 40 professionals, report to the CEO and Chairman of the Board and direct the organization’s financial planning, reporting and budgeting processes, systems integrations, treasury and banking, risk management and all other accounting and finance functions.

NOTABLE ACCOMPLISHMENTS

•	Negotiated significant cost of borrowing savings in multi-national bifurcated credit facilities over global credit facility.  Prepared 5-year business plan for combined Scholle IPN. 

•	Reduced annual personnel costs by restructuring Corporate and North American Finance teams without reduction in service levels.

•	Integrated Scholle (U.S.) and IPN Holding, BV entities, systems and operations post combination.  Led the effort to close and move the corporate office into a production facility resulting in significant savings annually.
 
Tempo de trabalho: 2015/2015 
Nível: Vice President - Chief Financial Officer 

**
Nome: Scholle Packaging, Inc. 
Localização: Northlake, IL 
Descrição: Led 30 professionals focused on all financial and accounting aspects of 7-plant operation throughout U.S., Canada, Mexico and Brazil, including financial reporting, internal controls, A/P, credit and collections, working capital management, inventory costing, plant accounting, payroll, fixed assets and taxes.  Managed multi-million dollar budgets.  

NOTABLE ACCOMPLISHMENTS

•	Negotiated significant cost reductions  with credit rating agencies, reduction in outside warehousing costs and a notable decrease in property taxes annually.

•	Designed and implemented multiple solutions to improve cash flows related to customer and supplier agreements, e.g., increasing supplier discounts and rebates.

•	Lead multiple Lean Manufacturing/ERP Business Process Kaizen Events that improved accuracy and consistency of scrap reporting, and improved effectiveness of distribution orders which improved global supply chain visibility, effectively lowering inventories and costs to expedite.

•	Leadership Engagement and Development (LEaD) Program Graduate – hand selected to participate in the program.  Part of inaugural senior management class, and an integral member of Marketing Strategy Development Team.
 
Tempo de trabalho: 2012/2015 
Nível: Director of Finance, Americas 

**
Nome: Scholle Packaging, Inc. 
Localização: Northlake, IL  
Descrição: Directed all financial and accounting aspects of Packaging’s 5-plant operation (previously 7 plants) in addition to providing shared services to 3 other divisions, including financial reporting, internal controls, A/P, credit and collections, working capital management, inventory costing, plant accounting, payroll, fixed assets and taxes.  Led team of 20 professionals and oversaw multi-million budgets.

NOTABLE ACCOMPLISHMENTS

•	Led multi-national, cross-functional Inventory Reduction Project Team, increasing inventory turnover by 20% and minimizing obsolescence.  Served as financial representative on Lean Manufacturing initiatives.

•	Lowered DSO from 40 to 31 days by improving collections and cash flow.

•	Reduced recruitment costs, and provided short and long-term career development opportunities for interns.  Directed Scholle accountancy internship program with NIU, whose Accountancy Department is perennially ranked in the top 20 nationally.  Interviewed, hired and mentored interns; several became high performing, high potential FTEs.
 
Tempo de trabalho: 2004/2011 
Nível: Controller - North America 

**
Nome: Scholle Corporation 
Localização: Northlake, IL/Manistee, MI/Norfolk, England 
Descrição: Managed all financial and budgetary controls, logistics and materials management and financial reporting of a multi-location, multi-national division. Performed M&A due diligence in acquisitions of foreign and domestic operations.  Key contributor to subsequent business systems implementation and cultural assimilation into the Scholle Corporation.  Negotiated hundreds of thousands of dollars in cost savings in material costs, freight rates and LOC/bank fees.
 
Tempo de trabalho: 2000/2003 
Nível: Controller - Custom Division 

**
Nome: Scholle Corporation 
Localização: Elmhurst, IL 
Descrição: Global project leader on business processes/applications for Baan ERP system implementation.  Key liaison between Information Services and Operating teams.  Global ERP Steering Committee member.  Led initial Baan ERP implementations in Europe and Australia.
